main.java.components.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.AbstractCyPhyComponent
        • main.java.components.controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.interfaces.CyPhyComponentI, ControllerImplementationI

    public class Controller
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.AbstractCyPhyComponent
implements ControllerImplementationI
    The class Controller implements the controller component. The controller component handle the management of the energy in the house the components register to the controller, which connect to them after this and call their services according to the actual available energy
    Author:
    Bello Memmi

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws fr.sorbonne_u.components.exceptions.ComponentStartException
        Description copied from interface: fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        start the component; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been initialised and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method must always return the control.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 post    isStarted()
        Specified by:
        start in interface fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI
        Overrides:
        start in class fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
        Throws:

        See Also:
        AbstractComponent.start()

                        java.lang.String inboundPortURI,
                        java.lang.String XMLFile)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Specified by:
        register in interface ControllerImplementationI
        Parameters:
        serial_number - of the device that has to register in Controller
        inboundPortURI - of the device that has to register in Controller
        XMLFile - describing offered control and how to connect required interfaces and offered interfaces
        Returns:
        true if the device has been registrated, false else
